meanings.definition: Rejects or refuses with disdain or contempt.
meanings.sent1: She spurns his offer to help, preferring to do it herself.
meanings.sent2: He spurns all invitations to social events, preferring solitude.
meanings.sent3: The cat spurns the new brand of food, turning up its nose in disgust.
meanings.sent4: The student spurns the outdated textbooks, opting for online resources instead.
meanings.sent5: The princess spurns the suitors who do not meet her high standards, seeking true love instead.

meanings.definition: Kicks or tramples on with disdain or contempt.
meanings.sent1: The bully spurns the smaller kids on the playground, showing no mercy.
meanings.sent2: The horse spurns the unfamiliar rider, refusing to be tamed easily.
meanings.sent3: The toddler spurns the vegetables on his plate, throwing them on the floor in protest.
meanings.sent4: The soccer player spurns the opponent's attempt to steal the ball, skillfully dribbling past them.
meanings.sent5: The giant robot spurns the puny humans, crushing their vehicles underfoot without hesitation.
